description: If you're a pumpkin lover, you must try our pumpkin coffee cake! Super moist, with a sweet, crunchy tahini oat topping that is to die for.  Do you prefer traditional streusel? We give you that option as well!
keywords: pumpkin, pumpkin spice, coffee cake, vegan
name: Pumpkin Coffee Cake
recipeIngredient: 2 flax "eggs" (2 tbsp ground flax + 1/3 cup water or plant milk) or 2 eggs
3 tbsp agave nectar or maple syrup
1/3 cup coconut oil, melted or neutral flavor oil (such as grape seed, sunflower or avocado)
1 1/2 tsp pumpkin pie spice (or to taste)

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat oven to 350°F. Lightly grease the bottom and sides of a 9 inch round cake pan and line it with parchment paper
Combine water or almond milk and ground flax (if using flax eggs). in a small bowl. Set aside
In a large bowl, whisk together pumpkin puree, agave or maple, oil and vanilla extract. Add almond milk/flax mixture (or eggs) and mix well
In a separate bowl, combine flour, baking powder, brown sugar, pumpkin pie spice and salt and Slowly add to the pumpkin mixture, whisking gently until just incorporated (do not over mix!). Set aside

To prepare the topping, whisk together the tahini, confectioners sugar and maple syrup. Is the mixture is too thick, and hard to whisk, add the plant milk (see note). Add the oats and mix well, until they're well coated. Using your hands, sprinkle the oat mixture on top of the cake batter
Bake at 350F for 40 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean
